meanings.definition: Deliberate destruction or obstruction of something
meanings.sent1: The sabotage of the machine caused it to stop working.
meanings.sent2: The enemy's sabotage of the bridge prevented our troops from crossing.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's playful sabotage of the bird feeder left the birds hungry.
meanings.sent4: The student's constant sabotage of his own success puzzled his teachers.
meanings.sent5: The sabotage of the garden by the mischievous rabbits made the farmer frustrated.

meanings.sent1: The history books are filled with tales of daring sabotages.
meanings.sent2: The group planned a series of sabotages to disrupt the enemy's operations.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie portrayed the bumbling sabotages of a group of friends.
meanings.sent4: The sabotages of the spy were so clever they seemed like magic tricks.
meanings.sent5: The sabotages of the villain always seemed to backfire in the end.

meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy or obstruct something
meanings.sent1: She sabotages her own chances by always arriving late.
meanings.sent2: The spy sabotages the enemy's plans by leaking false information.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sabotages the dog's attempts to catch the ball.
meanings.sent4: The storm seems to sabotage our plans for a picnic every weekend.
meanings.sent5: The virus can sabotage the computer system if not detected early.
